Additional information: The force is not on the same framework as many other forces and does not use anything similar to the item available under their framework as it does not suit the local crime type.

The force is not on the same framework as other forces and does not use the item code 20TOXA1. The service used by the force supplies test and a full evidential package, although no discounts are given for higher volumes.

This service is provided in-house. The force undertakes does not contract out as the service is undertaken by frontline officers using triage equipment generally in the first custody detention period. The rough cost of a triage equipment device is between £15 and £20.

The force does not use the described item code 22BF/B1/1 for comparison. All analyses are completed and procured on a case by case basis, depending upon the requirements. Suppliers previously used for the described item code both quoted different prices.

The new framework service that the force entered into does not work on individual prices for a specific type of transactions. Service costs for the whole year are based upon the number of search transactions that the force would have carried out in the previous year under the framework. This amounts to a forecasted figure of 16,428 enquiry transactions which are priced at £4.25 per enquiry. The force is allowed up to 10% more than the forecasted number of transactions free of charge but beyond the 10% level the cost is again £4.25 per transaction. Each Operational Unit that uses credit checks sets up a separate rolling Purchase Order based on previous usage and then renews once this has run out.
